$20's on the exhibits.﻿

The only time I have ever asked the question about if he thinks she is 
pretty was to let him know that blatantly looking at other women while he 
was with me was really inconsiderate.  I didn't care about his actual 
answer.  He got the point.  Although I could have just said, "do you think 
it's okay to stare at other women while you are with me?"  But sometimes 
passive aggressiveness comes out instead.﻿

comments.author: Irene Seppey

comments.text:
I used to pull that "Is she prettier?" with my fiancee ALL the time. Not 
gonna lie; I still get insecure sometimes. But I'll never forget the last 
time I asked such a question, about his model Spanish ex-girlfriend, who is 
also a hell of a lot older than me (yay for more insecurity). And he just 
looked at me, and said "Prettier involves personality too, so no, she's 
not. If I wanted to be with her I would be." And there the conversation 
rests to this day. Ladies, if a man wants to be with someone else, then he 
will be! Don't question his loyalty without reason, or you'll just drive 
him away!﻿

comments.text:
If a jealous partner (whom I don't know) called me in public to come over 
and listen to what their partner said about me (so that the jealous partner 
could guilt trip their lover), I'd cut them off by saying: "Umm, I don't 
appreciate hearing strangers making comments about my physical appearance." 
and give the jealous partner a dirty look so that they could have a taste 
of their own guilt-trip.

Why even bother making both parties feel uncomfortable just because of your 
own insecurities?﻿

comments.text:
I just say "Eh, she's alright." then shrug and then go back to my business. 
If she keeps prodding and asks "What does "alright" mean?" Then I'll sigh, 
then repeat "She's alright. She's okay. Nothing weird or abnormal."

That way, if she prods one more time, it's me who'll get angry. If it's my 
right to be angry--then I'll be comfortable being angry if prompted to.﻿

My boyfriend and I talk openly to each other about people besides each

comments.author: Keana Specht

comments.text:
Lol. If my boyfriend says, "Damn, she is *hot*," my response is generally 
to look, appraise, and then go, "Yeah, she *is* pretty hot," or, "Meh. Not 
my type, but I can see why you would think that." And the same goes for him 
if I tell him some guy is hot. And we're not even really bi. You can find 
the same gender attractive without being *attracted* to them, if that makes 
sense. Boyfriend and I don't care if we think other people are hot. It's 
not like we're gonna break up just because other people are attractive.﻿

This is such a female question to ask "do you think she's pretty?" cause 
guys never see another guy walk past and ask their gf the same. (I don't 
mean that in a bad way)

Maybe its a guy thing but if I'm with you thats all that should matter and 
despite the fact that you'll probably tell us at some point which guys you 
think are good looking I really have no need for that information.

Also her friends and the sister or any female relation version is like a 
mine field and if you say yes is normally followed by "do you think she is 
prettier than me?" which of course is no unless you want to end your 
relationship right then and there.

I just think its a pointless question﻿

comments.author: Bas van de Kleut

comments.text:
Don't date a woman who is insecure enough to ask if another woman is pretty 
to you or not. Problem solved. You don't see guys going around asking girls 
if they think another guy is hot. I'm sorry but women set themselves up for 
disappointment asking certain questions. ESPECIALLY if your man happens to 
be a blunt and honest man.﻿
comments.author: Terrell Hannah

comments.text:
+Sapphire Girl Yeah, that goes beyond simple insecurity, and sounds like he 
was an abusive person.
comments.author: Layla Bell

comments.text:
+Layla Bell You can't change a jealous person. I have a lot of guy friends 
that I regularly hang out with and he couldn't handle it. Not only that but 
he started getting worked up about me going out with girls and that's 
really tiring, because I had to fight at least once a week (usually more) 
about me going to play dungeons and dragons cause there is only one other 
girl. It's also hard because that person will never trust you which made me 
feel very bad like there had to be something about me that made him not 
trust me. It's over all just a bad place to be in and anyone in it should 
just get out because as I said before you can't change someone who is that 
insecure.
comments.author: Sapphire Girl

comments.text:
+Layla Bell I'll try my best to approach each of your comments to me. For 
starters, I have never EVER fantasized about my girlfriends best friend 
while having sex with her. I'm not sure exactly what you take me for, but 
I'm not that type of man. Secondly, you don't have to be "perfect" in order 
to know that some things are better left unsaid. Not sure how much I have 
to state this, but here goes once again: don't ask questions that you're 
not ready to hear the answers to. That's all I'm saying.
comments.author: Terrell Hannah

comments.text:
+Sapphire Girl What would happen if you said "okay" and walked up to the 
other guy and started a conversation and then returned to your boyfriend 
after a while?  Tell him if he keeps asking that question, you will keep 
talking to the other guys.  It's called negative reinforcement.
comments.author: Layla Bell

comments.text:

only grows worse and worse. Insecurity is a cancer.

easily from hearing the truth, why ask the question? You can't fault the 
person for being honest. The question should never been asked in the first 
place if you can't handle the answer. I was always taught to tell the truth 
and be honest.
comments.author: Terrell Hannah

comments.text:
+Terrell Hannah Honesty will be rude most of the time. Yes, I believe you 
should be honest, but not if it's not making a difference, just hurts the 
other person, then honesty can be tuned down a bit. But everything depends 
on what kind of person you are, not my, nor your experience can say what is 
really right, it can only say how we feel about it. Everything depends.
comments.author: tkdmh

comments.text:

about it, but be honest. And once again, don't ask questions if you're not 
ready to hear the honest answer. It's that freaking simple. lol
